description: Primes p such that the decimal digits of p^2 can be partitioned into two or more squares.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: 7 is present because 7^2=49 can be partitioned into two squares 4 and 9; 13^2 = 169 = 16_9; 37^2 = 1369 = 1_36_9.997^2 = 994009 = 9_9_400_9, 1063^2 = 1129969 = 1_12996_9, 997 and 1063 are primes, so 997 and 1063 are in the sequence.
prog: (Haskell)a048646 n = a048646_list !! (n-1)a048646_list = filter ((== 1) . a010051') a048653_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 17 2015
crossrefs: Cf. A010051, intersection of A048653 and A000040.
author: _Felice Russo_
extensions: Corrected and extended by _Naohiro Nomoto_, Sep 01 2001
